meanings.definition: To mark with small spots or specks.
meanings.sent1: She was specking the paper with colorful markers.
meanings.sent2: The artist was specking the canvas with tiny dots of paint.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child was specking the sidewalk with chalk drawings.
meanings.sent4: The night sky was specked with twinkling stars.
meanings.sent5: The chef was specking the cake with edible glitter for a festive touch.

meanings.definition: To cover with small spots or specks.
meanings.sent1: The baker was specking the donuts with powdered sugar.
meanings.sent2: The gardener was specking the garden path with flower petals.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy was specking the yard with muddy paw prints.
meanings.sent4: The forest floor was specked with fallen leaves of various colors.
meanings.sent5: The decorator was specking the walls with tiny golden stars for a magical effect.

meanings.definition: To sprinkle or dot with small spots or specks.
meanings.sent1: She was specking the cupcakes with rainbow sprinkles.
meanings.sent2: The chef was specking the dish with finely chopped herbs.
meanings.sent3: The children were specking the snowman with buttons and a carrot nose.
meanings.sent4: The meadow was specked with wildflowers of all colors.
meanings.sent5: The artist was specking the mural with tiny details to bring it to life.
